title: After Hours casual hand written script
content:
i hate it. but any ideas on what it might be?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/screenshot_4932.jpeg)
author: Will Miller

comments.content:
It seems some free font. I’ve searched whole dafont, [site name removed by moderator] websites..but couldn’t find this one.  
Identifying free font is difficult than the commercial.

:(

[Moderator note: Site names which contain questionable content will be removed even if no URL is given.]

I gave it a shot by looking through all 24 pages of the Script Font ID Guide, Part 11 (Everyday Hand-printing), but this wasn’t among the 500 or so fonts there.

This is one of those times when our [FAQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104309/http:/typophile.com/forums/typeid/faq) words about casual handlettered fonts should be read. (near the end of the page).

Since there is really nothing very dramatically different about this font, which may be custom, the best alternative is to find a site with a lot of handwritten fonts and pick one with a similar feel.

- Mike Yanega
